sense.gloss: Japanese umbrella pine (Sciadopitys verticillata), parasol pine, koyamaki
eastern red cedar (Juniperus virginiana), red cedar, red juniper, pencil cedar, aromatic cedar
Podocarpus macrophyllus var. maki (variety of yew plum pine)

sdata.j: 「お↑前↑↓まえ↓が↑折↑↓お↓った↑木↑↓き↓の↑種類↑↓しゅるい↓わかるか？」「いや↑知↑↓し↓らない」↑刑事↑↓けいじ↓に↑問↑↓と↓われ↑俺↑↓おれ↓は↑答↑↓こた↓えた。↑刑事↑↓けいじ↓は↑開↑↓ひら↓いたドアの↑方↑↓ほう↓を↑見↑↓み↓ながら「おい、こいつの↑折↑↓お↓った↑木↑↓き↓の↑種類↑↓しゅるい↓わかるか？」と↑声↑↓こえ↓を↑上↑↓あ↓げた。「えっと、↑槙↑↓まき↓らしいです」と↑若↑↓わか↓い↑女性↑↓じょせい↓の↑声↑↓こえ↓。↑刑事↑↓けいじ↓は↑居住↑↓いず↓まいを↑正↑↓ただ↓すと「お↑前↑↓まえ↓が↑折↑↓お↓った↑木↑↓き↓の↑種類↑↓しゅるい↓わかるか？」ともう↑一度↑↓いちど↓↑聞↑↓き↓いた。
sdata.e: Do you know what kind of tree you just broke? "No, I don't," I answered the detective. While looking through the open door, the detective shouted, "Hey, do you know what kind of tree he just broke?" "Um, looks like it's a yew plum pine," said the voice of a young woman. After straightening himself in his seat, the detective asked me one more time: "Do you know what kind of tree you just broke?"
